author: Staff Reporter
text:
Hindu Religious and Endowment Board, along with a private trust, planted 52 saplings of different species on a plot owned by the Akasharaya temple at Velayudhampalayam, near here, on Friday.

T. Sathyamoorthy, a social activist, who coordinated the planting, told reporters that 'ilupai', 'vembu' and few other herbal trees were planted on one acre. The land was remaining unused. The funds were allocated by HR and CE department.
title: Saplings planted
